intro: Ixorhea, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plants typically have basal rosettes of leaves and produce daisy-like inflorescences. Ixorhea species are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. They are known for their ornamental value and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their vibrant blooms.
